net.cabezudo.json.values

Class JSONString

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.cabezudo.json.JSONElement
      • net.cabezudo.json.values.JSONValue<JSONString>
        • net.cabezudo.json.values.JSONString
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<JSONString>, JSONable

    public class JSONString
extends JSONValue<JSONString>
    A JSONString is an object extended from JSONValue object in order to represent a JSON string that can be used to create JSON structures.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description

      Initializes a newly created JSONString object using the Character passed as argument.

      Initializes a newly created JSONString object so that it represents the same string as the argument.
      JSONString(java.lang.String value, Position position)
      Initializes a newly created JSONString object so that it represents the same string as the argument.

    • Method Detail

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(JSONString jsonString)
        Compares the string values represented by two JSONString objects.
        Parameters:
        jsonString - the JSONString to be compared.
        Returns:
        the integer value 0 if the argument JSONString is equal to this JSONString; a value less than 0 if this JSONString is lexicographically less than the JSONString argument; and a value greater than 0 if this JSONString is lexicographically greater than the JSONString argument.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object object)
        Compares this string to the specified object. The result is true if and only if the argument is not null and is a String object that represents the same sequence of characters as this object.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        object - The object to compare this String against
        Returns:
        true if the given object represents a String equivalent to this string, false otherwise

      • toReferencedElement

        public JSONValue toReferencedElement()
        /** Returns this JSONString object, a non referenced JSONString object is the same object than a referenced JSONString object because is not an JSON object to be referenced.
        Specified by:
        toReferencedElement in class JSONElement
        Returns:
        The element whose referenceable objects have been replaced with their references.

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Returns a hash code for this string. The hash code for a JSONString is the same hash that a String object.
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a hash code value for this object.

      • isString

        public boolean isString()
        Returns if the JSON element is a JSONString. This object represent a JSON string, so allways return a true.
        Overrides:
        isString in class JSONElement
        Returns:
        true because the object is a JSONString.

      • toArray

        public JSONValue[] toArray()

      • toBigDecimal

        public java.math.BigDecimal toBigDecimal()
        Try to create, using the BigDecimal constructor, a BigDecimal object using the BigDecimal rules for String and throw a NumberFormatException if the JSONString don't have a valid representation for a {code BigDecimal}.
        Overrides:

        Returns:
        a {code BigDecimal} result to translate the String represented in JSONString.
        Throws:

      • toBoolean

        public java.lang.Boolean toBoolean()
        Returns a Boolean with the boolean value represented by the specified string. The Boolean returned represents a true value if the string represented in this is not null and is equal, ignoring case, to the string true.
        Overrides:
        toBoolean in class JSONValue<JSONString>
        Returns:
        a {code Boolean} result to convert, using Boolean#valueOf(), the String represented in JSONString.

      • toByte

        public java.lang.Byte toByte()
        Constructs an return a newly allocated Byte object that represents the value indicated by the String value in the JSONString. The string is converted to a Byte value in exactly the manner used by the parseByte method for radix 10.
        Overrides:
        toByte in class JSONValue<JSONString>
        Returns:
        the value of this JSONString as a Byte.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - if the String does not contain a parseable Byte.

      • toByteArray

        public byte[] toByteArray()
        Convert the JSONString into an array of byte primitives. The result array is an array of only one element, the converted value of this object.
        Overrides:
        toByteArray in class JSONValue<JSONString>
        Returns:
        an array of JSONValue with a only one element.

      • toCalendar

        public java.util.Calendar toCalendar()
        Constructs an return a newly allocated Calendar object that represents the value indicated by the String represented in the JSONString. The string is converted to a Calendar value using the SimpleDateFormat parse method and the pattern specified for JSON.SIMPLE_DATE_FORMAT_PATTERN.
        Overrides:
        toCalendar in class JSONValue<JSONString>
        Returns:
        the value of this JSONString as a Calendar.
        Throws:
        JSONConvertionException - if the String does not contain a parseable Calendar.

      • toCharacter

        public java.lang.Character toCharacter()
        Convert the JSONString into a Character object using the this value. The result Character is a Character object created with the first character of the value String.
        Overrides:
        toCharacter in class JSONValue<JSONString>
        Returns:
        a Character.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the value String length is less than one.

      • toJSON

        public java.lang.String toJSON()

        Returns:
        a String with the JSON formated String.
